metadata.title: CVE-2023-23604 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description: A duplicate SystemPrincipal object could be created whenparsing a non-system html document viaDOMParser::ParseFromSafeString. This could have lead tobypassing web security checks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 109. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
